title: Hebrews Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Hebrews with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 13 chapters.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:3, after Jesus purged our sins, where did He sit?
options: On the right hand of the Majesty on high
At the left hand of God
At the foot of the cross
questions.correctAnswer: On the right hand of the Majesty on high
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:3 states that after Jesus purged our sins, He sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high.

questions.question: Who is described as 'without father, without mother, without descent' in Hebrews?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 7:3 describes Melchisedec as 'Without father, without mother, without descent,' highlighting his unique priesthood.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 4:12 says the word of God is sharper than any twoedged sword.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 4:12 clearly states that the word of God is quick, powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of ______, that we may obtain mercy...'
questions.explanation: Hebrews 4:16 urges believers to come boldly to the throne of grace to obtain mercy and find grace in time of need.

questions.question: What is the 'better hope' mentioned that allows us to draw nigh unto God, according to Hebrews 7:19?
options: The bringing in of a better hope
The sacrifices of bulls and goats
questions.correctAnswer: The bringing in of a better hope
questions.explanation: Hebrews 7:19 explains that the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope allows us to approach God.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:12, what did Jesus do after offering one sacrifice for sins forever?
options: Sat down on the right hand of God
questions.correctAnswer: Sat down on the right hand of God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:12 states that Jesus sat down at the right hand of God after offering one sacrifice for sins forever.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 10:4 teaches that the blood of bulls and goats can take away sins.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:4 clearly states it is not possible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.

questions.question: Which chapter emphasizes the superiority of Jesus' priesthood after the order of Melchisedec?
questions.explanation: Hebrews chapter 7 extensively discusses the priesthood of Melchisedec and the superiority of Jesus' priesthood after that order.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 3:12 warn believers about?
options: Beware of an evil heart of unbelief
Do not forsake the assembling of yourselves
Do not be forgetful to entertain strangers
questions.correctAnswer: Beware of an evil heart of unbelief
questions.explanation: Hebrews 3:12 warns believers to beware of an evil heart of unbelief that departs from the living God.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 6:18 speaks of God swearing by Himself because it is impossible for Him to lie.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 6:18 explains that God confirmed His promise with an oath because it is impossible for God to lie.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Let brotherly love continue. Be not forgetful to entertain ______.'
questions.explanation: Hebrews 13:1-2 encourages believers to continue brotherly love and not forget to entertain strangers.

questions.question: What is the main theme of Hebrews 11?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 11 is often called the 'faith chapter' and highlights many examples of faith from the Old Testament.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 12:1, what should we lay aside to run the race set before us?
options: Every weight and the sin which doth easily beset us
questions.correctAnswer: Every weight and the sin which doth easily beset us
questions.explanation: Hebrews 12:1 encourages believers to lay aside every weight and sin that easily entangles to run the Christian race.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 2:17 says Jesus was made like His brethren to be a merciful and faithful high priest.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 2:17 states that Jesus was made like His brethren to become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:25, what should believers not forsake?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:25 instructs believers not to forsake the assembling together, but to exhort one another.

questions.question: In Hebrews 13:8, who is declared to be the same yesterday, today, and forever?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 13:8 affirms that Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, today, and forever.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our ______.'
questions.explanation: Hebrews 4:15 states that Jesus is a high priest who can be touched with the feeling of our infirmities.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 9 teaches that the blood of Christ, like the blood of bulls and goats, is insufficient for purification.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 9 contrasts the insufficient blood of bulls and goats with the perfect blood of Christ which purifies conscience.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 6:4-6, what is impossible after falling away?
options: To renew them again unto repentance
questions.correctAnswer: To renew them again unto repentance
questions.explanation: Hebrews 6:4-6 warns that those who have fallen away cannot be renewed again to repentance.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 2:3 say is the salvation that was first spoken by the Lord and confirmed by them that heard Him?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 2:3 refers to the salvation spoken by the Lord and confirmed to us, which is the salvation of mankind.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 12:14 says 'Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord.'
questions.explanation: Hebrews 12:14 exhorts believers to follow peace and holiness, for without holiness no man shall see the Lord.

questions.question: Which verse in Hebrews says, 'The just shall live by faith'?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:38 quotes 'The just shall live by faith,' a key theme in the book.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more ______ for sins.'
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:26 warns that after willful sinning post-knowledge of truth, no more sacrifice for sins remains.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:14, what are angels described as?
options: Ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:14 describes angels as ministering spirits sent forth to minister to heirs of salvation.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 5:14 says strong meat is for those who have their senses exercised to discern good and evil.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 5:14 teaches that strong meat is for the mature who can discern good and evil through exercise of senses.

questions.question: Hebrews 13:5 advises believers to be content with what?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 13:5 instructs believers to be content with what they have, trusting that God will never leave them.

questions.question: What is the reason given in Hebrews 7:25 that Jesus is able to save to the uttermost?
options: Because He ever liveth to make intercession for them
questions.correctAnswer: Because He ever liveth to make intercession for them
questions.explanation: Hebrews 7:25 teaches Jesus can save completely because He lives forever to intercede for those who come to God through Him.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 12:29 refers to God as a consuming fire.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 12:29 states that our God is a consuming fire.

questions.question: What is described as a 'new and living way' in Hebrews 10:20?
options: The way consecrated by Jesus' flesh
questions.correctAnswer: The way consecrated by Jesus' flesh
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:20 describes the new and living way as consecrated through the veil, i.e., Jesus' flesh.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 3:14, what is necessary to be partakers of Christ?
options: Holding the beginning of our confidence steadfast unto the end
questions.correctAnswer: Holding the beginning of our confidence steadfast unto the end
questions.explanation: Hebrews 3:14 states that holding steadfast the beginning of confidence to the end is necessary to be partakers of Christ.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Faith is the substance of things hoped for, the ______ of things not seen.'
questions.explanation: Hebrews 11:1 defines faith as the substance and evidence of things hoped for and not seen.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 13:16 encourages believers to do good and communicate, for such sacrifices please God.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 13:16 exhorts believers to do good and share with others, which are sacrifices pleasing to God.

questions.question: Hebrews 9:27 states that it is appointed unto men once to do what?
options: To die, but after this the judgment
questions.correctAnswer: To die, but after this the judgment
questions.explanation: Hebrews 9:27 declares that men are appointed once to die and then face judgment.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 12:11 say about chastening?
options: It yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness
It is a sign of God's rejection
questions.correctAnswer: It yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness
questions.explanation: Hebrews 12:11 teaches chastening is painful but afterwards yields the peaceable fruit of righteousness.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 6:10 says God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labor of love.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 6:10 affirms that God remembers your work and labor of love, and is not unrighteous to forget.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 8:6, Jesus is the mediator of what kind of covenant?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:6 states that Jesus is the mediator of a better covenant established on better promises.

questions.question: In Hebrews 2:1, what is the warning concerning the word spoken?
options: To give the more earnest heed to it
To preach it only to Jews
questions.correctAnswer: To give the more earnest heed to it
questions.explanation: Hebrews 2:1 warns to give more earnest heed to the word spoken, lest we drift away.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a ______, let us lay aside every weight...'
questions.explanation: Hebrews 12:1 refers to being surrounded by a cloud of witnesses, encouraging believers to lay aside every weight.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 13:4 says marriage is honorable in all, and the bed undefiled.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 13:4 states that marriage is honorable and the marriage bed undefiled.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:8, what is the scepter of Jesus' kingdom?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:8 says Jesus' throne is forever and the scepter of His kingdom is righteousness.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 13:20 describe God as?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 13:20 calls God the God of peace who brought up Jesus from the dead.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 9:11 says Christ entered the holy place by His own blood, obtaining eternal redemption.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 9:11 explains that Christ entered the holy place by His own blood to obtain eternal redemption.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:22, how should we draw near to God?
options: With a true heart in full assurance of faith
questions.correctAnswer: With a true heart in full assurance of faith
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:22 teaches to draw near with a true heart and full assurance of faith.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 11:6 say about faith and pleasing God?
options: Without faith it is impossible to please Him
questions.correctAnswer: Without faith it is impossible to please Him
questions.explanation: Hebrews 11:6 states that without faith it is impossible to please God.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 6:19 describes hope as an anchor of the soul, both sure and steadfast.
questions.explanation: Hebrews 6:19 calls hope an anchor of the soul, sure and steadfast, entering within the veil.
